course_title: Topics in Italian Culture in Translation: Between Cultures and Cuisine
class_notes:
(Same as CHN 375 1)
In this Maymester course you will examine Chinese American and Italian American cuisines in the context of immigration and identity. The first two weeks the course will meet online, the third and final week the class will meet in person in New York City to explore Chinatown and Little Italy. Experience food, art, and culture in Chinese and Italian communities, interact with heritage speakers of Chinese and Italian languages and more.


This course is permission only. To be considered for enrollment you must complete the online application (https://oisp.emory.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=Programs.ViewProgramAngular&id=11029). Once your application is approved and you submit your deposit, Summer Programs will enroll you in the course.
course_description: Topics to be announced each semester. Course is offered in English. Course content will vary, including topics of literature, history, culture, art history, political thought, current trends, and more. May be repeated for credit when syllabus changes.
